get.summary: Find relevant devices using various criteria.
get.description:
Returns details of relevant devices belonging to an enrollment user matching specified criteria, where results are ranked/sorted using the specified orderby criteria.
seensince and lastseen fields accept the following Valid DateTime formats : yyyy/MM/dd, yyyy-MM-dd, MM/dd/yyyy, MM-dd-yyyy, yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.fff, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff, MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss.fff, MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss.fff, yyyy/MM/ddTHH:mm:ss.fff, yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fff, MM/dd/yyyyTHH:mm:ss.fff, MM-dd-yyyyTHH:mm:ss.fff, yyyy-MM-dd HH-mm-ss-tt, yyyy-MM-ddTHH-mm-ss-tt.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Filters devices based on enrolled username

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Filters devices based on model. For example iPhone

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Filters devices based on platform. For example Apple

parameters.name: lastseen
parameters.description: Filters devices based on date when they were lastseen

parameters.name: ownership
parameters.description: Filters devices based on ownership type. One of C, E, S or Undefined

parameters.name: lgid
parameters.description: Limits the search to given OrganizationGroup, defaults to user's OrganizationGroup

parameters.name: compliantstatus
parameters.description: Filters devices based on specified compliant status. One of Compliant, NonCompliant or NotAvailable

parameters.name: seensince
parameters.description: Filters devices based on date when they were seen after given date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Filters search result to return results based on page number. Page numbering is 0 based and omitting this parameter will return first page

parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.description: Limits the number of search results per page. Defaults to 500

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sort results based on given field. One of model, lastseen, ownership, platform, deviceid etc. Defaults to deviceid

parameters.name: sortorder
parameters.description: Sort order of results.One of ASC or DESC. Defaults to ASC.

patch.summary: New - process a product to activate/deactivate for all the applicable devices
patch.description: For activate, It processes the input product for all the devices in assigned smart groups. It also updates device product compliance status and job statistics. For deactivate, It updates the queued jobs of the input product and mark them for deletion. Also, gets the list of delivered jobs for the input product and updates device product job status to be cancelled.

patch.summary: New - Partially updates Smart Group criteria.
patch.description:
Partially updates Smart Group criteria by adding or removing values to rules like Organization groups, user groups, etc.                         
------------Example--------------  
[
  {op: "add", path: "/smartGroupsOperationsV2/organizationGroups", value: "069DC0E2-D4E2-E611-8114-005056AF67FF, 069DC0E2-D4E2-E611-8114-005056AF67FF"},
  {op: "remove", path: "/smartGroupsOperationsV2/users", value: "069DC0E2-D4E2-E611-8114-005056AF67FF, 069DC0E2-D4E2-E611-8114-005056AF67FF"},
  {op: "add", path: "/smartGroupsOperationsV2/devices", value: "069DC0E2-D4E2-E611-8114-005056AF67FF"},
  {op: "add", path: "/smartGroupsOperationsV2/tags", value: "123, 345"},
  {op: "remove", path: "/smartGroupsOperationsV2/platforms", value: "WindowsMobile, Apple, BlackBerry, Android, Athena, Motorola, WindowsPhone, WindowsPc, AppleOsX, WindowsPhone8, WinRT, BlackBerry10, AppleTv, Qnx, ChromeBook, Tizen, ChromeOS"}     
]     
-------------Platforms--------------  
"WindowsMobile, Apple, BlackBerry, Android, Athena, Motorola, WindowsPhone, WindowsPc, AppleOsX, WindowsPhone8, WinRT, BlackBerry10, AppleTv, Qnx, ChromeBook, Tizen, ChromeOS"    
-----------Ownerships-------------    

 "CorporateDedicated, CorporateShared, EmployeeOwned, AllOwnerships"

parameters.name: smartGroupsOperations
parameters.description: Model containing operation type, resource path and value. Supports add and remove operations.(Required)

WindowsDesktopUpdatesPayloadEntity.description: An entity class representing the updates profile payload for windows desktop platform.

allowMUUpdate.description:
0  Not allowed or not configured.
1  Allowed.Accepts updates received through Microsoft Update.

allowUpdateService.description:
0  Update service is not allowed.
1 (default)  Update service is allowed.

deferFeatureUpdatesPeriodInDays.description:
Defers Feature Updates for the specified number of days.
Supported values are 0-180.

deferQualityUpdatesPeriodInDays.description:
Defers Quality Updates for the specified number of days.
Supported values are 0-30.

excludeWUDriversInQualityUpdate.description:
0 (default)  Allow Windows Update drivers.
1  Exclude Windows Update drivers.

pauseFeatureUpdates.description:
0 (default)  Feature Updates are not paused.
1  Feature Updates are paused for 60 days or until value set to back to 0, whichever is sooner.

pauseQualityUpdates.description:
0 (default)  Quality Updates are not paused.
1  Quality Updates are paused for 35 days or until value set back to 0, whichever is sooner.

scheduledInstallTime.description:
Supported values are 0-23, where 0 = 12 AM and 23 = 11 PM.
The default value is 3.

scheduleInstallDay.description:
The following list shows the supported values:
0 (default)  Every day
1  Sunday
2  Monday
3  Tuesday
4  Wednesday
5  Thursday
6  Friday
7  Saturday

updateSource.description:
Update source
Supported values are 1 and 2.
1 - Microsoft Update Service (default)
2 - WSUS (Windows Server Update Service)

limitPeerUsageToMembersWithTheSameGroupI.description: Limit per usage to member with same group id.

installSignedUpdatesFromThirdPartyEntiti.description: Can install signed updates from third party.

activeHoursStart.description: Active hours start for reboot restriction.

activeHoursEnd.description: Active hours end for reboot restriction.

pauseFeatureUpdatesStartTimeString.description: Gets or sets the the date and time when the administrator wants to start pausing the feature updates.

pauseQualityUpdatesStartTimeString.description: Gets or sets the date and time when the administrator wants to start pausing the quality updates in string format.

activeHoursMaxRange.description: Specifies the max active hours range. This value sets max number of active hours from start time.

autoRestartDeadlinePeriod.description: Specifies the deadline in days after which a reboot for updates will become mandatory.

autoRestartNotificationSchedule.description: Specifies the period for auto-restart reminder notifications.

autoRestartRequiredNotificationDismissal.description: Specifies the method by which the auto-restart required notification is dismissed.

engagedRestartDeadline.description: Specifies the deadline in days before automatically scheduling and executing a pending restart outside of active hours.

engagedRestartSnoozeSchedule.description: Specifies the number of days a user can snooze engaged restart reminder notifications.

scheduleRestartWarning.description: Specifies the period for auto-restart warning reminder notifications.

scheduleImminentRestartWarning.description: Specifies the period for auto-restart imminent warning notifications.

detectionFrequency.description: Specifies the update scan frequency from every 1 to 22 hours.

allowDualScanForDeferralPolicies.description: Specifies whether scans (dual scan) are allowed against windows update.

ignoreMOAppDownloadLimit.description: Specifies whether to ignore the MO download limit (allow unlimited downloading) over a cellular network for apps and their updates.

ignoreMOUpdateDownloadLimit.description: Specifies whether to ignore the MO download limit (allow unlimited downloading) over a cellular network for OS updates.

allowVpnPeerCaching.description: Specifies whether the device is allowed to participate in peer caching while connected via VPN to the domain network.

minimumBatteryRequiredForPeerUploads.description: Specifies any value between 1 and 100 (in percentage) to allow the device to upload data to LAN and group peers while on battery power.

maximumAllowedCacheSize.description: Specifies the maximum cache size that delivery optimization can utilize, as a percentage of disk size (1-100).

minimumDiskSizeForDeviceToUsePeerCaching.description: Specifies the required minimum disk size (capacity in GB) for the device to use peer caching.

minimumRAMForDeviceToUsePeerCaching.description: Specifies the minimum RAM size (capacity in GB) required to use peer caching.

minimumContentFileSizeThatCanUsePeerCach.description: Specifies the minimum content file size (capacity in MB) enabled to use peer caching.

driveLocationUsedForPeerCache.description: Specifies the drive that delivery optimization should use for its cache.

maximumDownloadBandwidthThatADeviceWillU.description: Specifies the maximum download bandwidth in KiloBytes/second that the device can use across all concurrent download activities using delivery optimization.

maximumDownloadBandwidthAsAPercentageOfT.description:
Specifies the maximum download bandwidth that delivery optimization uses across all concurrent download activities as a percentage of available download
bandwidth.

minimumQosForBackgroundDownloads.description: Specifies the minimum download QoS (Quality of Service or speed) in KB/sec for background downloads.

monthlyUploadDataCap.description: Specifies the maximum total bytes (capacity in GB) that delivery optimization is allowed to upload to internet peers in each calendar month.

PrimaryBatteryCustomChargeStopLimit.description: Percentage (0..100) at which primary battery should stop charging.

PeakShiftBatteryThreshold.description:
This is a percentage-based number that follows the Windows reported battery life value.
The goal of this setting is to try and ensure that Peak Shift does not turn off charging 
when the battery is in danger of running out of power.
If the Battery Threshold is reached, the system will switch to AC power ,even if the 
system has not yet reached Peakshift End. 
However, charging will not resume until Peak Shift Charge Start time is reached.
Note: Peak shift Battery threshold takes the value in the range between 15-100.
